issue.title: WASM: Upcoming tasks
issue.body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/761

From [Zulip Chat: Building LFortran inemscripten-forge](https://lfortran.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/197339-general/topic/Building.20LFortran.20in.20emscripten-forge), it seems we need the following support:

- [x] building to `wasm` at `CI` (Release type. If it works unexpectedly, we need to recompile in Debug mode and debug it.) (#157)
- [x] auto uploading the built `lfortran.wasm` && `lfortran.js` to https://dev.lfortran.org/ (#157)

Also, other supports needed:
- [x] support `pow` for `x**2` case [https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/118 (merged)](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/118)
- [x] start with sufficient memory in the generated `wasm` (more details at [comment](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/99#issuecomment-1207330794), [comment](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/99#issuecomment-1207342062)) [https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/126 (merged)](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/126).
- [x] passing array data from/between `wasm` and `JavaScript`
- [x] generate the WASM "imports" based on `bind(c)` interfaces (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/771) (#588 
- [x] drawing/visualizing the image (generated by `wasm`) on `canvas`

body:
I tried the following test cases at the current live site https://dev.lfortran.org/ 
- `integration_tests/abs_01.f90`
- `integration_tests/abs_02.f90`
- `integration_tests/abs_03.f90`
- `integration_tests/intrinsics_21.f90` // for `modulo()` and `mod()`
- `integration_tests/intrinsics_23.f90` // for `huge()`
- `integration_tests/floor_01.f90`
- `integration_tests/floor_02.f90`
- `integration_tests/floor_03.f90`

They all seem to work. Thus, it seems the `runtime` library works at https://dev.lfortran.org/

Please, could someone possibly share if this issue is safe to close?
Nice, great job! Try this: use the default example and change `dp=8` to `dp=kind(0.d0)`. I get: Kind of good, but not quite. :)

Thank you for sharing the bug, Ondrej Sir. We merged a `PR` https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/657 which should (hopefully) fix the issue. I also submitted a `PR` at https://github.com/lfortran/lcompilers_frontend/pull/40 to update the `lfortran` version/commit to be used at https://dev.lfortran.org/

>Try this: use the default example and change dp=8 to dp=kind(0.d0). I get:

With the fixes in https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/657 and https://github.com/lfortran/lcompilers_frontend/pull/40, the latest `lfortran` at https://dev.lfortran.org/ seems to now support it.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43722035/186198654-be80f984-7269-4729-965f-7137484736f2.png)

>integration_tests/abs_01.f90
integration_tests/abs_02.f90
integration_tests/abs_03.f90
integration_tests/intrinsics_21.f90 // for modulo() and mod()
integration_tests/intrinsics_23.f90 // for huge()
integration_tests/floor_01.f90
integration_tests/floor_02.f90
integration_tests/floor_03.f90


I tested these examples again at https://dev.lfortran.org/. They all seem to work. Thus, it seems the runtime library works at https://dev.lfortran.org/

Please, could someone possibly share if this issue is safe to close?

I tested this by hand as well and I think everything is indeed fixed! Amazing.

The parts of the runtime library that do not work are all calls into C, however I am guessing just providing the appropriate JavaScript implementations might fix it. We will eventually use pure Fortran implementations of trigonometric functions like sin(x). But for now we can either implement them in JavaScript, or figure out how to compile the C part of the runtime library using Clang and somehow link it.

issue.title: GSoC 2022: Implementing custom WASM Backend for LFortran Roadmap
issue.body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/700

- [x] Initial `wasm->wat` backend (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1757)
- [x] Setting up testing infrastructure (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1760)
- [x] Enable LLVM based WASM backend in LFortran (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1769 , https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1768 )
- [x] Compile (LFortran + wasm backend) to wasm
    - [x] compile essential components to wasm (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1796)
    - [x] support runtime library (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/issues/555)
- [x] Setup a demo page at [lfortran.org](https://lfortran.org/) that hosts LFortran and compiles Fortran and runs in the browser
    - [x] build a basic frontend ([repo](https://github.com/Shaikh-Ubaid/lcompilers_frontend))
    - [x] deploy to [dev.lfortran.org](https://dev.lfortran.org/) (https://github.com/lfortran/lcompilers_frontend)
- [x] Implement CI testing
    - [x] https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/711 (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1794)
    - [x] https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/712 (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1797, https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1808)
    - [x] install `node`/`emscripten` at `CI` (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/157)
- [x] Add support for 32-bit and 64-bit integer numbers and operations between them:
    - [x] support for constants/literals (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1789)    
    - unary operators 
        - [x] unary minus (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1791)
    - arithmetic operators 
        - [x] basic (Add, Sub, Mul, Div) (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1762)
        - [x] pow operation (for x**2) (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/118)
        - [x] modulo operator (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1834)
    - [x] relational operators (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1823)
    - [x] logical operators (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1824)
- [x] Add support for 32-bit and 64-bit floating point numbers and operations between them
    - [x] support for constants/literals (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1792)
    - unary operators
        - [x] unary minus (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1792)
    - arithmetic operators
        - [x] basic (Add, Sub, Mul, Div) (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1792)
        - [x] pow operation (x**2.0) (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/118)
    - [x] relational operators (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1823)
    - [x] modulo operator (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1834)
- [x] Wrap program statements (global statements) into a function (lets say `_main` or `main_`) (first commit of https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1794)
- Add support for if-else blocks in the wasm backend
    - [x] basic support (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1809)
    - [x] extended support (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1823, https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1824)
- [x] Add support for loops in the wasm backend
    - [x] basic support (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1830)
    - [x] support for cycle (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1830)
    - [x] support for break (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1830)
- [x] Add support for functions and subroutines
    - [x] basic support and function calls
    - [x] support declaring functions in any order (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/635)   
- Miscellaneous
    - [x] support variable initialisation at declaration (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1834)
- [x] Add support for casting/type-conversion (https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/1822)
- [x] Add support for strings
    - [x] Basic support (https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/640) 
- [x] Add support for arrays
    - [x] Initial Support (#49 #55)
    - [x] `real` and `logical` types support (#66)
    - [x] compile-time multi-dimensional arrays (#70, #99, #109) 
- [x] Add some demo, say some image processing/mandelbrot, show the result in canvas on the demo page ([dev.lfortran.org](https://dev.lfortran.org/))
